Author: nanijoe
Content: They might as well buy mutual funds and call it a day.

Author: jgamman
Content: didn't i read some of that in an old JoSoftware article?  the "just a big ol' pile of work" bit seems to be how he describes PM using his bugtracker - maybe there's a 4th place that does software development well: Fog Creek.

Author: mironathetin
Content:
With scripting language I had something like jython in mind. It is indeed another code-layer ontop of java to interpret the scripts. And, not unlike python, its dead slow in some cases.

Someone reported about a factor of 100 for java against Ruby. jython is only 50. But this is still so bad that I would not waste my time.

Author: baha_man
Title: Titan Rain - how Chinese hackers targeted Whitehall

Author: wouter
Content:
As one of the founders of Wakoopa, I know it's really hard to find a good name for your (internet) company AND be able to buy the corresponding domain name relatively cheap.

As people pointed out above, "Google" and "Yahoo" also didn't describe the service they are offering and also are not really pronounceable without spelling. In the end, it's all about the service the company is offering and we're pretty sure that we're doing okay in this department.

More here: http://blog.wakoopa.com/archives/whats-in-a-name
